paragraphs.content: Chapter 11
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 11

paragraphs.content: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

paragraphs.content: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: God hath not cast away his people which he foreknew. Wot ye not what the scripture saith of Elias? how he maketh intercession to God against Israel, saying,

paragraphs.content: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, they have killed thy prophets, and digged down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

paragraphs.content: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But what saith the answer of God unto him? I have reserved to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed the knee to the image of Baal.

paragraphs.content: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

paragraphs.content: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwise grace is no more grace. But if it be of works, then is it no more grace: otherwise work is no more work.

paragraphs.content: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded
paragraphs.contentHtml: What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded

paragraphs.content: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.
paragraphs.contentHtml: (According as it is written, God hath given them the spirit of slumber, eyes that they should not see, and ears that they should not hear;) unto this day.

paragraphs.content: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And David saith, Let their table be made a snare, and a trap, and a stumblingblock, and a recompence unto them:

paragraphs.content: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.

paragraphs.content: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I say then, Have they stumbled that they should fall? God forbid: but rather through their fall salvation is come unto the Gentiles, for to provoke them to jealousy.

paragraphs.content: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Now if the fall of them be the riches of the world, and the diminishing of them the riches of the Gentiles; how much more their fulness?

paragraphs.content: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the apostle of the Gentiles, I magnify mine office:

paragraphs.content: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If by any means I may provoke to emulation them which are my flesh, and might save some of them.

paragraphs.content: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if the casting away of them be the reconciling of the world, what shall the receiving of them be, but life from the dead?

paragraphs.content: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root be holy, so are the branches.

paragraphs.content: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert grafted in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And if some of the branches be broken off, and thou, being a wild olive tree, wert grafted in among them, and with them partakest of the root and fatness of the olive tree;

paragraphs.content: Boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Boast not against the branches. But if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root thee.

paragraphs.content: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou wilt say then, The branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.

paragraphs.content: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Well; because of unbelief they were broken off, and thou standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear:

paragraphs.content: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if God spared not the natural branches, take heed lest he also spare not thee.

paragraphs.content: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold therefore the goodness and severity of God: on them which fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continue in his goodness: otherwise thou also shalt be cut off.

paragraphs.content: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be grafted in: for God is able to graft them in again.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they also, if they abide not still in unbelief, shall be grafted in: for God is able to graft them in again.

paragraphs.content: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For if thou wert cut out of the olive tree which is wild by nature, and wert grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree: how much more shall these, which be the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?

paragraphs.content: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.

paragraphs.content: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And so all Israel shall be saved: as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the Deliverer, and shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob:

paragraphs.content: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For this is my covenant unto them, when I shall take away their sins.

paragraphs.content: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As concerning the gospel, they are enemies for your sakes: but as touching the election, they are beloved for the fathers’ sakes.

paragraphs.content: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the gifts and calling of God are without repentance.

paragraphs.content: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For as ye in times past have not believed God, yet have now obtained mercy through their unbelief:

paragraphs.content: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so have these also now not believed, that through your mercy they also may obtain mercy.

paragraphs.content: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For God hath concluded them all in unbelief, that he might have mercy upon all.

paragraphs.content: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
paragraphs.contentHtml: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!

paragraphs.content: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?

paragraphs.content: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be recompensed unto him again?

paragraphs.content: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For of him, and through him, and to him, are all things: to whom be glory for ever. Amen.
